Strings.FileExists: The file "%1" already exists. %CDo you really want to replace it?
Strings.FileCouldNotReplace: The file "%1" could not be replaced.%CContinue anyway?
Strings.FileDelete: Are you sure to delete all selected files?
Strings.ChangesNotSaved: Changes have not been saved. If you continue all changes will be lost.%CSave changes now?
Strings.DoubleArtist: The artist you entered already exists in the libraray.%CEntered artist was not added to the library.
Strings.FileAlreadyExistsRename: The file "%1" already exists. %C"%2" could not be renamed.
Strings.InvalidName: The path or filename is not valid. Please check.
Strings.InvalidCharFormat: Wrong character found in the format string. Please check this.
Strings.InvalidCharPath: Wrong character found in the path string. Please check this.
Strings.InvalidFormat: The format entered is not valid. Please check this.
Strings.InvalidPath: The path entered is not valid. Please check this.
Strings.ToolMissing: Please enter a description and a path or check the default player box.
Strings.ErrorTFExists: The file could not be renamed because the filename already exists. Perhaps two or more files have the same TAG.
Strings.TAGRemove: Are you sure to remove all TAG Ver. %1 information%Cfrom the selected files?
Strings.FreeDBToLong: Please select a proper number of files (1-99) with a play time shorter then 100 minutes.
Strings.ErrorCouldNotWriteChanges: Changes could not be save. Perhaps the file is write protected or in use or was renamed or removed by another application.
Strings.InvalidPathLength: The new path would be longer the 255 char. so it could not be changed.
Strings.Convert2324: There are frames in the TAG Ver. 2.3 which are no longer%Csupported in ver. 2.4. If you continue, these frames will be lost.%CContinue anyway?
Strings.Convert2423: There are frames in the TAG Ver. 2.4 which are no longer%Csupported in ver. 2.3. If you continue, these frames will be lost.%CContinue anyway?
Strings.SelectFiles: You have to select one or more files before using this function.
Strings.DoubleCommD: The comment descriptor you entered already exists in the libraray.%CEntered descriptor was not added to the library.
Strings.ConnectionFailed: Connection to server failed. Please check your internet connection.
Strings.Matches: Matches were found. They are listed in the tree now.
Strings.Name: Progress ...
Strings.Split: Splitting artist information into artist and title
Strings.FileCopyText: Please select the folder the file(s) should be copied to.
Strings.FileMoveText: Please select the folder the file(s) should be moved to.
Strings.FileAddDir: Please select the folder whose files should be added to the list.
Strings.SplitATText: Please enter the separator between Artist and Title

frmCaseConv.chkAlwaysFirst: Always uppercase first letter of entry
frmCaseConv.lblInfo: All the words in the list will always be written in the casing you entered here.

frmCompareFileTAG.chkReplaceUnderScore: Replace characters not allowed in filenames by "_"
frmCompareFileTAG.lblInfo: This function compares the current filename with the filename created by the format. If there is a mismatch the file will be marked.
frmCompareFileTAG.framePara: Parameters (Tip: click the label to add the parameter to the format)

frmDouble.optAD: Find files with same audio data (LENGTHLY operation)
frmDouble.optATA: Find files with same artist, title, album
frmDouble.optAT: Find files with same artist and title

frmFilenameToTAG1.lblInfo: This function offers you the possibilty to extract information from the filename and write it into the TAG. Enter the format using the parameters above. To save the format give it a description (using the following syntax: "Description: Format") and add it to the list.
frmFilenameToTAG1.framePara: Parameters (Tip: click the label to add the parameter to the format)

frmFilenameToTAG2.chkSaveName: Save filename to original filename entry
frmFilenameToTAG2.lblInfo: This function offers you the possibilty to extract information from the filename and write it into the TAG. Enter the format using the parameters above. To save the format give it a description (using the following syntax: "Description: Format") and add it to the list.
frmFilenameToTAG2.framePara: Parameters (Tip: click the label to add the parameter to the format)

frmFreeDB.lblSearchWord: ID3-TagIT will try to find the CDs that match the selected MP3 files. So it is nessesary for a successful search to select all files of the album in the correct order.
frmFreeDB.pnlWrite: Where should the selected information be stored?
frmFreeDB.lblInfo: With this function you can query FreeDB for information. For connection settings go to the preferences.

frmFreeDBAssociate.lblInfo: Associate the selected files with entries found in the FreeDB. Only checked files will be tagged.

frmLibraries.lblInfo1: You can group different directories under one Favourite so that can access them directly with one click.
frmLibraries.chkOnlyOwn: Use only the own genres entered above in TAG Ver. 2 genre dropdown lists
frmLibraries.lblDescGenre: To this library you can add your own genres for Ver. 2 TAGs which will then appear in the dropdown boxes for TAG Ver. genres. The relations between TAG Ver. 1 and TAG Ver. 2 genres are used when the "Transfer function" is started, so e. g. a genre in TAG Ver. 1 becomes the genre you entered above in TAG Ver. 2.
frmLibraries.lblCorres: Corres&ponding TAG Ver. 1 genres for transfer from Ver. 1 to Ver. 2 and Ver. 2 to Ver. 1:
frmLibraries.lblDescArtist: You can add the name of the artists you are using to this library and every time you enter an artist name in a dialog, these Artists will be shown as a suggestion. The buttons "Get artists" will add the artists found in the currently shown files.
frmLibraries.lblInfo2: Add or remove comment descriptors which will be displayed in the TAG Ver. 2 Edit dialogs.

frmLists.lblInfo1: M3U playlists can include some extended information with the format above you can choose which information should be put into the playlist.
frmLists.framePara: Parameters (Tip: click the label to add the parameter to the format)
frmLists.lblInfo2: This functions makes it possible to create a filelist in a user defined format which is defined by a template. The templates listed below can be found and edited in the ID3-TagIT installation folder under Templates. There you will also find a textfile with all necessary instructions to edit or create templates.
frmLists.lblInfo3: This option allows to create a HTML or CSV file without a template. Select the file format(s) and choose the columns.
frmLists.frameTAGInfo: Choose TAG Ver. for creating list
frmLists.optID3V1: Use TAG Ver. &1 for creating the list
frmLists.optID3V2: Use TAG Ver. &2 for creating the list
frmLists.lblPath: &Path and Filename of the list(s) (without extension):

frmOrganize.chkCopy: Copy files instead of moving them
frmOrganize.lblInfo: With this dialog you can orginze your MP3 files within folders using the TAG information. Enter the format using the parameters above. To save the format give it a description (using the following syntax: "Description: Format") and add it to the list.
frmOrganize.framePara: Parameters (Tip: click the label to add the parameter to the format)

frmPreferences.chkExplorerContext: Show "ID3-TagIT" in the folder context menu of the Windows Explorer
frmPreferences.lbl2: Number of digits of filename enumeration:
frmPreferences.lblTracknumbers: Number of digits of track numbers in filenames:
frmPreferences.optEditCur: Open 'Edit TAG Ver. &X' dialog corresponding to current view
frmPreferences.lblDescript: Only checked columns will be displayed. You can reorder the columns by moving them up or down. The filename column will always be visible.
frmPreferences.lblDigits: Number of digits of track numbers in Ver. 2 TAGs:
frmPreferences.optUse24: Use Ver. 2.&4 for new TAGs of TAG Ver. 2
frmPreferences.optUse23: Use Ver. 2.&3 for new TAGs of TAG Ver. 2
frmPreferences.Label5: Text color of mismatches Filename<->TAG files:
frmPreferences.Label6: Background color of mismatches Filename<->TAG files:
frmPreferences.lblTextEncInfo: NOTE: The text encoding will only be used for new TAG Ver. 2 frames. Already present frames will not be changed when the TAG is saved.

frmRemoveFolders.chkIgnoreOther: Delete all folders with no MP3 files ignoring any other possible present files. (WARNING: This will delete non MP3 files when no MP3 files are found in a folder)
frmRemoveFolders.lblInfo: This function will scan a folder with its subdirectories and remove all subdirectories which do not contain any files.

frmSelectFormat.lblInfo: This function offers you the possibilty to select all the files which match the format you entered above. <ABC> stands for a alphanumeric string while <123> stands for a numeric only string.
frmSelectFormat.framePara: Parameters (Tip: click the label to add the parameter to the format)

frmTransfer.chkExists: Do not overwrite existing TAG entries

frmTAG1ToFilename.lblInfo: This function offers you the possibilty to extract information from the filename and write it into the TAG. Enter the format using the parameters above. To save the format give it a description (using the following syntax: "Description: Format") and add it to the list.
frmTAG1ToFilename.framePara: Parameters (Tip: click the label to add the parameter to the format)

frmTAG2ToFilename.chkRebuildName: Rebuild filename from original filename entry if present (ignores format)
frmTAG2ToFilename.lblInfo: This function offers you the possibilty to extract information from the TAG and write it into the filename. Enter the format using the parameters above. To save the format give it a description (using the following syntax: "Description: Format") and add it to the list.
frmTAG2ToFilename.framePara: Parameters (Tip: click the label to add the parameter to the format)

frmTAG1Multi.lblInfoStar: You can use the following parameters to enter the information from one field into another: <A>=Artist, <T>=Title, <B>=Album, <C>=Comment, <K>=Track number, <Y>=Year, <G>=Genre

frmTAG2.lblDigits: Number of digits of track numbers:
frmTAG2.lblCommDescInfo: Predefined comment descriptors can be set under Edit Libraries (Options menu)
frmTAG2.lblGenreInfo: Note: Many programs only show the first genre entered. So move the important genre to the top of the list.
frmTAG2.lblOYearInfo: (In TAG Ver. 2.3 only the year entry will be saved)
frmTAG2.chkPicInclude: Include picture within the MP3 file when saving
frmTAG2.chkPicRelativPath: Use relativ path if the picture is not included (bold in list)
frmTAG2.lblInfo: The rating is 1-255 where 1 is worst and 255 is best. Note that many programs have their own rating scale. The scale 1-255 is given by the ID3 standard and the other programs rescale it.
frmTAG2.lblNot: All frames which are not supported by ID3-TagIT. You cannot edit them but you can remove them by unchecking the checkbox.

frmTAG2Multi.lblInfoStar:
You can use the following parameters to enter the information from one field into another: =Artist, =Title, =Album, =Track number, =Total number of tracks,

=Position in media set,

=Total number of medias, =Year, =Genre, =Comment, =Content group, =Subtitle, =Orchster/Band, =Conductor, =Modified/Remixed by, =Composer, =BPM
frmTAG2Multi.lblDigits: Number of digits of track numbers:
frmTAG2Multi.lblCommDescInfo: Predefined comment descriptors can be set under Edit Libraries (Options menu)
frmTAG2Multi.lblGenreInfo: Note: Many programs only show the first genre entered. So move the important genre to the top of the list.
frmTAG2Multi.chkTLEN: Create track length entry from file
frmTAG2Multi.lblOYearInfo: (In TAG Ver. 2.3 only the year entry will be saved)
frmTAG2Multi.chkPicInclude: Include picture within the MP3 file when saving
frmTAG2Multi.chkPicRelativPath: Use relativ path if the picture is not included (bold in list)
frmTAG2Multi.lblInfo: The rating is 1-255 where 1 is worst and 255 is best. Note that many programs have their own rating scale. The scale 1-255 is given by the ID3 standard and the other programs rescale it.
frmTAG2Multi.CheckBox37: Remove all existing user web frames first
frmTAG2Multi.CheckBox36: Remove all existing user text frames first

frmEncoding.lblTextEncInfo: This will change the text encoding of the TAG Ver. 2 frames of the selected files from ANSI to Unicode or vise versa.
